001package org.consensusj.jsonrpc;
002
003import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException;
004import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JavaType;
005import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode;
006import org.slf4j.Logger;
007import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
008
009import javax.net.ssl.HttpsURLConnection;
010import javax.net.ssl.SSLContext;
011import javax.net.ssl.SSLSocketFactory;
012import java.io.IOException;
013import java.io.InputStream;
014import java.io.OutputStream;
015import java.net.HttpURLConnection;
016import java.net.URI;
017import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
018import java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture;
019
020/**
021 * JSON-RPC Client using {@link HttpURLConnection} formerly named{@code RpcClient}.
022 * <p>
023 * This is a concrete class with generic JSON-RPC functionality, it implements the abstract
024 * method {@link AbstractRpcClient#sendRequestForResponseAsync(JsonRpcRequest, JavaType)} using {@link HttpURLConnection}.
025 * <p>
026 * Uses strongly-typed POJOs representing {@link JsonRpcRequest} and {@link JsonRpcResponse}. The
027 * response object uses a parameterized type for the object that is the actual JSON-RPC `result`.
028 * Using strong types and Jackson to serialize/deserialize to/from strongly-typed POJO's without
029 * using intermediate `Map` or `JsonNode` types.
030 *
031 */
032public class JsonRpcClientHttpUrlConnection extends AbstractRpcClient {
033    private static final Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(JsonRpcClientHttpUrlConnection.class);
034    private final URI serverURI;
035    private final String username;
036    private final String password;
037    private static final String UTF8 = StandardCharsets.UTF_8.name();
038    private final SSLSocketFactory sslSocketFactory;
039
040    /**
041     * @deprecated Use {@link JsonRpcClientHttpUrlConnection#JsonRpcClientHttpUrlConnection(SSLContext, JsonRpcMessage.Version, URI, String, String)}
042     */
043    @Deprecated
044    public JsonRpcClientHttpUrlConnection(SSLSocketFactory socketFactory, JsonRpcMessage.Version jsonRpcVersion, URI server, final String rpcUser, final String rpcPassword) {
045        super(jsonRpcVersion);
046        this.sslSocketFactory = socketFactory;
047        log.debug("Constructing JSON-RPC client for: {}", server);
048        this.serverURI = server;
049        this.username = rpcUser;
050        this.password = rpcPassword;
051    }
052
053    public JsonRpcClientHttpUrlConnection(SSLContext sslContext, JsonRpcMessage.Version jsonRpcVersion, URI server, final String rpcUser, final String rpcPassword) {
054        super(jsonRpcVersion);
055        this.sslSocketFactory = sslContext.getSocketFactory();
056        log.debug("Constructing JSON-RPC client for: {}", server);
057        this.serverURI = server;
058        this.username = rpcUser;
059        this.password = rpcPassword;
060    }
061
062    /**
063     * Construct a JSON-RPC client from URI, username, and password
064     *
065     * @param jsonRpcVersion version for {@code jsonrpc} field in messages
066     * @param server server URI should not contain username/password
067     * @param rpcUser username for the RPC HTTP connection
068     * @param rpcPassword password for the RPC HTTP connection
069     */
070    public JsonRpcClientHttpUrlConnection(JsonRpcMessage.Version jsonRpcVersion, URI server, final String rpcUser, final String rpcPassword) {
071        this(getDefaultSSLContext(), jsonRpcVersion, server, rpcUser, rpcPassword);
072    }
073
074    /**
075     * Get the URI of the server this client connects to
076     * @return Server URI
077     */
078    @Override
079    public URI getServerURI() {
080        return serverURI;
081    }
082
083    /**
084     * Send a JSON-RPC request to the server and return a JSON-RPC response.
085     *
086     * @param request JSON-RPC request
087     * @param responseType Response type to deserialize to
088     * @return JSON-RPC response
089     * @throws IOException when thrown by the underlying HttpURLConnection
090     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException when the HTTP response code is other than 200
091     */
092    @Override
093    public <R> JsonRpcResponse<R> sendRequestForResponse(JsonRpcRequest request, JavaType responseType) throws IOException, JsonRpcStatusException {
094        HttpURLConnection connection = openConnection();
095
096        // TODO: Make sure HTTP keep-alive will work
097        // See: http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/net/http-keepalive.html
098        // http://developer.android.com/reference/java/net/HttpURLConnection.html
099        // http://android-developers.blogspot.com/2011/09/androids-http-clients.html
100
101        if (log.isDebugEnabled()) {
102            log.debug("JsonRpcRequest: {}", mapper.writeValueAsString(request));
103        }
104        
105        try (OutputStream requestStream = connection.getOutputStream()) {
106            mapper.writeValue(requestStream, request);
107        }
108
109        int responseCode = connection.getResponseCode();
110        log.debug("HTTP Response code: {}", responseCode);
111
112        if (responseCode != 200) {
113            handleBadResponseCode(responseCode, connection);
114        }
115
116        JsonRpcResponse<R> responseJson = responseFromStream(connection.getInputStream(), responseType);
117        connection.disconnect();
118        return responseJson;
119    }
120
121    @Override
122    public <R> CompletableFuture<JsonRpcResponse<R>> sendRequestForResponseAsync(JsonRpcRequest request, JavaType responseType) {
123        return supplyAsync(() -> this.sendRequestForResponse(request, responseType));
124    }
125
126    private <R> JsonRpcResponse<R> responseFromStream(InputStream inputStream, JavaType responseType) throws IOException {
127        JsonRpcResponse<R> responseJson;
128        try {
129            if (log.isDebugEnabled()) {
130                // If logging enabled, copy InputStream to string and log
131                String responseBody = convertStreamToString(inputStream);
132                log.debug("Response Body: {}", responseBody);
133                responseJson = mapper.readValue(responseBody, responseType);
134            } else {
135                // Otherwise convert directly to responseType
136                responseJson = mapper.readValue(inputStream, responseType);
137            }
138        } catch (JsonProcessingException e) {
139            log.error("JsonProcessingException: ", e);
140            // TODO: Map to some kind of JsonRPC exception similar to JsonRPCStatusException
141            throw e;
142        }
143        return responseJson;
144    }
145
146    /**
147     * Prepare and throw JsonRPCStatusException with all relevant info
148     * @param responseCode Non-success response code
149     * @param connection the current connection
150     * @throws IOException IO Error
151     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException An exception containing the HTTP status code and a message
152     */
153    private void handleBadResponseCode(int responseCode, HttpURLConnection connection) throws IOException, JsonRpcStatusException
154    {
155        String responseMessage = connection.getResponseMessage();
156        String exceptionMessage = responseMessage;
157        int jsonRpcCode = 0;
158        JsonRpcResponse bodyJson = null;    // Body as JSON if available
159        String bodyString = null;           // Body as String if not JSON
160        InputStream errorStream = connection.getErrorStream();
161        if (errorStream != null) {
162            if (connection.getContentType().equals("application/json")) {
163                JavaType genericResponseType = mapper.getTypeFactory().
164                        constructParametricType(JsonRpcResponse.class, JsonNode.class);
165                // We got a JSON error response -- try to parse it as a JsonRpcResponse
166                bodyJson = responseFromStream(errorStream, genericResponseType);
167                JsonRpcError error = bodyJson.getError();
168                if (error != null) {
169                    // If there's a more specific message in the JSON use it instead.
170                    exceptionMessage = error.getMessage();
171                    jsonRpcCode = error.getCode();
172                    // Since this is an error at the JSON level, let's log it with `debug` level and
173                    // let the higher-level software decide whether to log it as `error` or not.
174                    // i.e. The higher-level software can set error level on this module to `warn` and then
175                    // decide whether to log this "error" not based upon the JsonRpcStatusException thrown.
176                    // An example occurs in Bitcoin when a client is waiting for a server to initialize
177                    // and returns 'Still scanning.. at block 530006 of 548850'
178                    log.debug("json error code: {}, message: {}", jsonRpcCode, exceptionMessage);
179                }
180            } else {
181                // No JSON, read response body as string
182                bodyString = convertStreamToString(errorStream);
183                log.error("error string: {}", bodyString);
184                errorStream.close();
185            }
186        }
187        throw new JsonRpcStatusException(exceptionMessage, responseCode, responseMessage, jsonRpcCode, bodyString, bodyJson);
188    }
189
190    private static String convertStreamToString(java.io.InputStream is) {
191        java.util.Scanner s = new java.util.Scanner(is, UTF8).useDelimiter("\\A");
192        return s.hasNext() ? s.next() : "";
193    }
194
195    private HttpURLConnection openConnection() throws IOException {
196        HttpURLConnection connection =  (HttpURLConnection) serverURI.toURL().openConnection();
197        if (connection instanceof HttpsURLConnection) {
198            ((HttpsURLConnection) connection).setSSLSocketFactory(this.sslSocketFactory);
199        }
200        connection.setDoOutput(true); // For writes
201        connection.setRequestMethod("POST");
202        connection.setRequestProperty("Accept-Charset", UTF8);
203        connection.setRequestProperty("Content-Type", "application/json;charset=" +  UTF8);
204        connection.setRequestProperty("Connection", "close");   // Avoid EOFException: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/19641374/android-eofexception-when-using-httpurlconnection-headers
205
206        String auth = username + ":" + password;
207        String basicAuth = "Basic " + base64Encode(auth);
208        connection.setRequestProperty ("Authorization", basicAuth);
209
210        return connection;
211    }
212}
